Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Vindubai
Reviews.Content: Great location, and very helpful staff .... Great view from the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to cool your heels”
Reviews.Author: chunkymonke
Reviews.Content: The reason why this hotel has so many 'excellent' reviews is quite simply as it is a superb place to stop when you visit Istanbul. The rooms are spacious and large so you don't feel cooped up and the bathroom is beautiful and clean with a lovely deep tub to soak in! I travelled with my son (6 yrs old, full of energy, he gave a 'thumbs up' after jumping on the beds) and my mother (lets just say she's got her free bus pass) who loved the fact that there was a lift (very important after a long day walking around the historic sites) as not all the boutique hotels have lifts and she adored the cleanliness of the hotel and room. We stayed in a triple room and the furniture was very comfortable and all the soft furnishings were pristine, nothing appeared worn in any way, it was just as the official hotel photo's show. The chairs in the room were also very comfortable and we faced the front of the hotel so had a lovely juliette balcony to look out over the street. The hotel is situated about 20metres down a side street from the main thoroughfare so you literally fall out of the front door and are right in the thick of things. The room had great sound insulation so our sleep was never disturbed by any noise during the nights. The staff were faultless, everything we required was executed swiftly and without fuss whether it was room service, taking tea in the grand foyer or obtaining information at the concierge. Breakfast is served in the rooftop terrace restaurant which has lovely views and a further viewing level is accessible from here which is open all the time. The breakfast was very good with a wide variety of both hot and cold dishes, cereals, breads, fruit, cold-cuts etc. There was something for everyone. I am sure the evening meals were also exquisite but we ended up eating out every night due to our itinery. The restaurant staff were polite and discreet at all times. The great location of this hotel means that all the sights are no more than 10-15min walk away and the tram stops at the top of the street if your feet are tired. The blue mosque, hagia sophia and grand bazaar are easily within walking distance but you might want to take the tram for topkapi palace and the harbour where you'll find the spice bazaar, galata bridge and onwards to taksim square. I normally like to book flights and hotels separately but on this occasion I could not beat the combined price by BA (bear in mind that you MUST fly to ataturk for istanbul; the other airport will mean you spend half a day getting to your hotel!). I would also recommend that you take the metro/tram into the city centre. It's just as quick as a cab but one tenth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: seenitallpprune
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient and the lobby is impressive, but little else is worth the 230 euros/night. Room size is average, no view from half the rooms, and the front desk clerk is unhelpful (a statement that doesn't apply to the bellboys). Further, you can't even control the heat/cooling in your room. While there is a thermostat, it just doesn't function. The Sultanhan prices itself as a luxury hotel, but delivers only a very average experience. You can do much better for equal or less cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel perfetto per un week-end a Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Claudia Z
Reviews.Content: L'hotel Subtanhan si trova in una posizione davvero ideale per visitare Istanbul. A poche centinaia di metri si trovano la Cisterna, La moschea Blu, l'Aya Sofia e altre numerose attrazioni. Due fermate delle metro di trovano a meno di 5 minuti dall'Hotel. Vicino si trova anche l'Hammam Cemberlitas. Ottima la colazione, il personale Ã© gentilissimo. Le camere sono classiche, sempre pulite. L'accesso gratuito al WI-fi Ã© sicuramente molto apprezzato. In poche parole un Hotel consigliassimo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: amanda f
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend this lovely hotel in the heart of old Istanbul. The location is perfect, right in the centre of all the sights and close to the tram and to good restaurants. The rooms are a good size and nicely furnished, and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast, with its stupendous views from the top of the hotel, was always enjoyable but some might miss the full English, which was not on offer. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and had an excellent meal with friendly and efficient service. We would be very happy to stay there again. Istanbul is an amazing city and this hotel is an excellent base.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BiancaT1810
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a truly great place to stay in Istanbul. Not only is it in the centre of Sultanhamet with most places of interest practically on the doorstep (Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Archeological Museum and the best Turkish Baths ever), it is also very quiet at the same time. The staff are super and friendly, the room we had was quite and spacious - laundry is changed daily. We had a B&B deal and breakfast is in a rooftop restaurant with wonderful views over the Bosphorous. A great place to take pics. Breakfast was a good choice for differing palates - not exactly 5 star but good enough and all fresh and tasty. We did not take advantage of the Turkish Bath or Sauna in the hotel so cannot comment - far too much to do outside - time did not allow! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and return to stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: eshaw07960
Reviews.Content: One of the best travel experiences from the wonderful food (no additives/pesticides/hormones in the food chain) and people very friendly and helpful, telling us they love Americans. The sights are beyond description and the tram and public transportation system very easy to use.Went for the contemporary art which makes the NY scene a little tired and redundant; many women artists and women making beautiful contemporary objects for the home. Three different distinct areas of the city to explore with their own character. Ten days was barely enough to absorb this interesting secular environment ( they have voted since the early 1800s)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: talltraveler1208
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance of all the major sites (5 minutes from Sofia Hagia). It is a half block from the main street with the tram. Nice large room, good service, and a nice free breakfast atop the hotel. Set off the main street so it is relatively quiet. It is a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SwimmingGnome
Reviews.Content: This was a most wonderful stay in the Old City of Istanbul. The staff was most accomodating. The room was spacious and well appointed. Comfortable beds, extra pillows. The roof top restaurant with dining inside and on the terrace, affords the most excellent view of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Bosphorus. Food and wine was great and service was very personalized. Every request was filled with pleasure, even if it was not on the menu. Definitely a place to stay while visiting Istanbul. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, The Cisterns and Archeological museum are an easy 10 min. walk from the hotel. Around the corner are great local restaurants with good reasonably priced food. The tram is right there as well. This hotel made our stay in Istanbul outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A most excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheR0berts0ns
Reviews.Content: Reached by driving through narrow back streets and then there it is. A marble edifice with a doorman/porter leaping to take your bags! Reception staf very helpful indeed. Check-in very efficient (drinks appeared on a tray) and so to the room. Well fitted, great bed and toiletries fine. Told of good places to eat that night and off we walked....There is no shortage of excellent eateries once you get past MacDonalds(!) Its hard to make recommendations since we never had a bad meal! Discovered all the main sights were within a five minute walk. Breakfast in the roof/terrace restaurant...What a view...From the Bosphorus to Blue Mosque etc. Restaurant is very good....We had a birthday dinner for my wife and they produced the best chocolate cake ever! When we return (not if) this is where we'll stay again. Ian & Alison London

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Msm956
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay in the old city. Large rooms, great restaurant, and exceptional service. The view from the terrace is about the best around. Close to everything and some great and inexpensive local restaurants. The only comment is that the Internet wireless signal is a little weak in the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LordByron
Reviews.Content: I agree with other posters that this is an excellent hotel in the classic style very conveniently located to all the big sites. From the welcoming drink as you check in to the apple tea as you sit in the lobby to the great breakfast choice served on the top floor terrace with an amazing view, this hotel is perfect for a visit to Istanbul. Everything is within walking distance including the famous Pudding Shop and if you want to dine at the Fish Market complimentary transport can be arranged. Tip: Visit the Grand Bazaar, but buy your souvenirs elsewhere as the GB is full of low quality stuff probably made in China. The Spice Market is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: lolasmomHouston
Reviews.Content: Checked out of this hotel a couple of days ago and could not have been more pleased with the experience. Great location, very reasonably priced, wonderfully helpful concierge (Yasar), huge breakfast buffet included. I will recommend this place to my friends/family and will stay here again on next visit. Close to all the great stuff and the rail line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the ancient city”
Reviews.Author: fnct
Reviews.Content: Very hospitable welcome and brought directly to our rooms. Our luggage did not make it onto our connecting flight and the hotel front desk took care of locating our luggage and getting it to our rooms that night. The bellman in the lobby was a very nice man who always got you the elevator and when you sat in the lobby had a cup of tea or coffee in front of you before you could even think to ask. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast area was on the top floor and had 360 degree view of the old city. On one side was the Blue Mosque the other side was Haige Sophia. Good buffet and very nice service. This hotel was a 5 minute walk from the center of the ancient city. It was close but just outside the noise and congestion. While there are a number of things to do and see in the "new city", we liked staying in the old city more. Less traffic and hustle. A good selection of restaurants around the hotel within a 15 minute walk. I would recommend; Yesil Ev and Zinhan. Zinhan is probably best best Kabob house in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, lovely staff, delicious food and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in Hotel Sultanhan in Istanbul. The rooms are spacious with ensuite bathrooms, minibars and flat-panel tvs. The hotel staff are highly efficient, paticularly the receptionists downstairs. They served delicious continental breakfast on the roof with stunning views every morning. We were in a central location for Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Overall a very good value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great positon, food, rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: saffy55151
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, just 200 meters off one of the main drags in Sultanahmet.Just 500 meters from the Blue Mosque and about 700 meters from the Topkapi Palace, also the souk. Lots of great cafes and restaurants, very safe.Roof top restaurant(also for breakfast) magic view out over Istanbul and fab food. Only complaint I have and this stuff is important is that we asked for a wake up call for an early pick up to go to Gallipoli and it didnt happen, just happened last weekend in Sydney too, hotels need to pick up on that, even tho we all have cell phone alarms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to see all the sights”
Reviews.Author: ExpatsBath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days recently. We found it to be in an excellent location as it is only a few minute's walk from all the major attractions e.g. Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc. The extremely efficient tram system is very close by as well as lots of friendly restaurants. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful and seemed keen to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. The street this hotel is in, altho reasonably attractive, it's main benefit is that it is nice and quiet (a rare thing in Istanbul!) The air conditioning was effective (very hot in July) and it was a relief to return to the hotel after the heat of the city. All in all a very good choice for a short stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Patches07
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person, have travelled extensively, and have been a travel agent for 17 years. Needless to say, it is hard to please me. Having said that, when we travel I like to find hotels that have the flavour and feel of the city/country that they are in , along with North American comforts (air conditioning, good service, quiet, good beds, clean, etc). We stayed at the Sultanhan twice during our recent trip to Turkey for a total of 5 nights. It is definitely a great find and I would stay there again. The front desk staff is very friendly and anxious to help with any request. The rooms are large, well-appointed, air-conditioned and very quiet (so no wake-up at 5am to the sounds of the call to prayer). They are well-situated just off the Divan Yolu (tram street) so it is a 3-5 minute walk to Hippodrome/Blue Mosque/Hagia Sofia/Basilica Cistern and many other sites. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Their breakfast buffet on the roof terrace (amazing views!) was the best we had in Turkey . We also decided to eat there for one dinner and, again, excellent food and service. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 26Years-StillGoing
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Sultanhan for two days prior to a cruise of the northern Aegean. My wife and I really liked the hotel, and found the staff to be professional, courteous and friendly. Our room was quiet, with beautiful wood floors and comfortable furniture. The location is perfect, just down the street from the main road to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, both in easy walking distance (downhill, which means an uphill walk on the return). Many good restaurants right in the area. Plus a super breakfast on the rooftop, with some of the best rolls we've ever had. The hotel is on a quiet dead end street, safe and clean. Our only criticisms are that the tub only had a flexible shower hose for sitting in it and showering - and the pillows were pretty poor. Not a big deal, and certainly not a reason not to come to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JhhDjh_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location very close to the Grand Bazaar and to the Blue Mosque. We stayed one night before heading off to Cappadocia, Gallipoli, etc and returned after a week. It felt just like we had come home - the staff were so welcoming! Very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cozy hostel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TheWojciech
Reviews.Content: Very good hostel located in a fantastic area of Istanbul, very close to many touristic places. Restaurant and bar with great, turkish climate, easy-going staff, good food and clean rooms. The only thing we disliked were the bathrooms - the shower isn't seperated from the rest of the bathroom in any way, so after taking a shower the water is everywhere and you can't do anything about it. All in all I really recomend Sultan to stay whenever visiting Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: operagirl21
Reviews.Content: What a lovely, centrally located hotel! We can't say enough good things about the courtesy and friendliness of the staff! The room was clean, comfortable, and service was impeccable. There is a great rooftop restaurant-excellent buffet breakfast, and we had two wonderful dinners-the view was fantastic, as were our meals. We hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy basic hotel. Best location!”
Reviews.Author: p_herge
Reviews.Content: It's good enough if you're not very demanding in terms of luxury and service. It's a basic cosy and clean place, with nice staff. Breakfast is ok and the views from the terrace (quite unkept when we stayed) provide good angles for photos, but aren't so good as a whole. It's definetly a 4 star experience with a GREAT location. 50 meters from Divan Yolu (the street with the Tram line), where you can easily walk to Sultanahmet main attractions (to the right) or to the Grand Bazaar (to the left). TheTram (cheap and quick) will take you to many other interesting locations like Kabatas (Dolmabahce Palace) or EminÃ¶nÃ¼ (cruise boat piers and fantastic Spice Bazaar). No need to go far for a good restaurant (Amedros, Mosaic, Korashani, Faros...). Further away try the fantastic Pasazade (read: Pashazaduh) in Sirkeci and Pandeli over the entrance of Spice Bazaar (lots of reviews in TA). Be aware: If you ask for Twin rooms you risk facing a building in a very narrow side street. Ask for (demand!) front view.We turned ac off because it was noisy (luckily it wasn't hot yet). There's only one 5 star hotel in Sultanahmet (the Four Seasons) and it's not far away...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiDalmata
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here the last week of May 2011 and LOVED it! The location was perfect for exploring all of the Sultanhamet...we walked everywhere. The room and bathroom were very nicely appointed; the breakfast was nice each day up on the roof terrace with great views; nice & helpful staff. The Hammam is not to be missed! We enjoyed the full service treatment- Turkish Bath/soap/scrub/massage...it was terrific and a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ritika727
Reviews.Content: My stay at Sultanhan Hotel was perfect. The hotel location is close to everything in the old city and the hotel staff were very professional, helpful and polite. They could not do enough for their clients! My room was large and well-decorated with gorgeous Turkish rugs and wall hangings (as is the entire hotel) and, it was surprisingly quiet. The breakfast buffet selection was very good and the views from the rooftop terrace were magnificent. I can't say enough about this hotel and their fabulous staff. I will stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: vmadan
Reviews.Content: The Sultanhan is very well located - it is walking distance from the major landmarks of Istanbul. It is a charming hotel with a wonderful staff. On checking in we were given a room which was on the backside of the hotel (there is no view from there) - we requested for a change and were promptly acommodated. The hotel front desk were extremely helpful when we sought their advise on things that we should do in Istanbul and gave us multiple options. The rooms, though on the smaller side and very well done and dont have anything missing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: OuthwaiteJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very traditional and has a warm, friendly feel. The staff were extremely helpful but never intrusive. The location is perfect for the old city situated a very short walk to the tram line, but within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Aghia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar and Hippodrome. There is a Turkish Hammam and sauna in the basement of the hotel, this we needed to book in advance, and when we did, were not disappointed, the facility is well looked after and clean. There are an array of great restaurants again in walking distance - Mozaik, and Rumeli our favourites.

Reviews.Title: “All we could ask for”
Reviews.Author: runsinthefamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly situated near the centre of the old town and within walking distance of the Blue Mosque in one direction and The Grand Bazaar in the other. The room was well appointed and comfortable but like so many European hotels had no tea making facilities. The restaurant on the top floor had stunning views towards the Bosphorous in one direction and the city in the other. Breakfast was good: pastries better than the cooked but we did not use the restaurant in the evening as it seemed to lack atmosphere as it was too cold to eat outside. The staff and concierge could not do enough for us - organised restaurants, taxis to outlying attractions and answering every question cheerfully. The hanan was also very good with a Russian masseuse who gave us a good going over!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VivienneF2
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel and would definitely stay again. It is situated very close to the beautiful Blue Mosque, the ancient city cisterns, the grand bazaar and lots of fun restaurants. It was very strange not to have tea and coffee making facilities in the room especially considering there was a mini bar. Perhaps the bathroom could do with a little refurbishment but all in all it was comfortable and relaxing. There are lots of embroidered pieces on the walls of the hotel including our room which adds to the overall Turkish flavour of the place. The view from the rooftop is stunning. There is no swimming pool which is a bit of shame but there is a sauna and spa which looked marvelous but we didn't try it as we were only staying for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: TheOranges
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here in a superior room. Walking distance to many of the "must see" sites. Staff was very helpful. Rooftop terrace was fantastic (the evening call to prayers is spine-tingling up there). Free WiFi. One minor caution: if you take the 1/2 day Bosphorus cruise recommended by the front desk, you get a "not optional" shopping stop for leather jackets and they don't bring you back to the hotel (drop off near Blue Mosque which is walking distance, but nobody told us, so we weren't prepared).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: yogapanda
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room for three, October 2010 with my Mum(83) and Sister. Clean, comfortable, quiet, friendly staff, , fabulous location , good breakfast, what more could one ask for ? We couldn't fault it. I am well travelled and I was impressed with this little jewel. The staff gave me access to their lap top, they printed out all my boarding passes, they confirmed bookings for me, the staff were all lovely. My thanks once again to them. Topkapi , Blue Mosque etc was any easy 10 min walk away(my Mum is 83). Come out of hotel ,go right , main road only metres away . Go right again then just keep walking untill you see the Mosque.Topkapi, Besillica next door to each other.(go early , 9.30am is a good time, no queues or tour groups) We found an amazing short cut to The Grand Bazzar. Go left at main road from Hotel, , and just walk two tram stops --- and there it is. 5 mins at a walking pace, 10 mins stroll.Lots of nice local cafes there for a cheap and cheerful pre or post shopping pit stop. Restaurants are for tourists, you won't find rustic Turkish food in the Sultanahmet distict. I was dissapointed by the price of wine in Restaurants, 30 Euros for a bottle and 5 Euros for a glass,, BIG rip off there!!! Istanbul is just fantastic. It has been cleaned up and is as safe as any other city. If you want to do any private tours this company is AMAZING , and they are a FRACTION of the price. istanbultripadvisor.wordpress.com . ask for Ugar (pronounced as OOR ) Ilgar. He is a wonderful person with a very gentle personality and has a great sense of humour. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff, but dingy dark room and bathroom in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: mifccak
Reviews.Content: The location is good, although it is hard to find. Nice terrace restaurant where breakfast was OK. Rooms was dark, woke up to look out of the window to view of a brick wall. The decor is very dated, and the bathroom needed replacing. Staff were very helpful, but overall I think that it is incredibly overpriced for what it represents.

Reviews.Title: “one treasure!!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseM2
Reviews.Content: I like a lot to stay at this hotel!!It is near the principal atractios in Istanbul!!You can do everythink walking!!and the room and the service is very nice!!I recomend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis”
Reviews.Author: C1andG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. Our room was large and comfortable, and although it faced the side street where the hotel is located, it was very quiet. Loved the terrace restaurant on the fifth floor with its view over the old city. Great location close to all the major sites, with many nearby restaurants. The traffic in Istanbul was very congested, so it was worth it to stay in a hotel that was walking distance to almost everything that we wanted to see. We also used the tram to get to the waterfront, which was easy to use but very crowded (watch your wallet!).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Makomaska
Reviews.Content: i would entire hearty suggest this hotel. it has a large position (5 minutes walk from the foremost sites) and a couple of minutes to walk to the shopping center where you can effortlessly journey over the Golden Horn. Rooms were spacious and morning meal was inside outlook of the azure mosque. And take the Hotel coach to the airport - journeying in luxury was a large way to end a brilliant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Top Notch Staff”
Reviews.Author: atraveler246
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 3 night stay at this hotel and found it the most wonderful accommodation in the best location. Our room was large and beautifully decorated. The breakfast was wonderful on the 5th floor terrace with views of the mosque and water. We walked to the historic sights such as the Blue Mosque, Sofia, Topkapi Palace. The tram is only one half block away and very easy to use. The the incredible staff made our stay most pleasant. Husevin at the front desk made many suggestions to us about what to see and do. He suggested the "Spectacle" show (a Turkish variety) and made arrangements for us to be picked up at the hotel. The bellman, Ozgur, was so kind and provided excellent service with a big smile. Stay here while in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel which meet all international high standard requirements”
Reviews.Author: rpashabekova
Reviews.Content: Personnel are friendly, room was always clean and tidy, restaurant staff were just amazing, they are doing their best for each traveller atmosphere is wonderfull meal is OK, tasty (breakfast and etc.)

Reviews.Title: “despite the hiccup at the airport - fantastic hotel - very central and clean”
Reviews.Author: explorerx1x
Reviews.Content: I had organised to be picked up from the airport but after waiting for 20 minutes was told (once i found the hotel number) that the pick up car had broken down on it's way there and that i needed to find alternate transport. I arrived in the hotel pretty annoyed and was immediately ushed into our room. My anger and frustration immediately vanished. The hotel is slap bang in the middle of Istanbul. Our room had a good view of the Bospherous and was within walking distance to pretty much everything. THis was very handy as once i had bought another item in the bazaar, i walked to the hotel and dropped off the item and then continued shopping. The hotel itself is very well done and furnished beautifully. The breakfast is delicious and is taken on the hotel's roof which overlooks the bospherous. In summary this was a great find - the only downside being there is no swimming pool though it was not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevensusan
Reviews.Content: this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. we prefer straying in boutique/non-chain hotels and this hotel has architectural features and decorations consistant with the area but the dedicated staff and many of the amenities you would expect at a ritz carlton. the staff were extremely helpful , the rooms comfortable and impeccably clean. we were there during an extreme hot spell and the room air conditioners were very effective. the roof top breakfast is quite good and they will prepare eggs for you if requested without additional charges.. the location is also good in that it is a 5 min walk to the grand bazaar and a few more minutes to the blue mosque and h sofia

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with an AMAZING LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: Puhup_Verma
Reviews.Content: we decided to travel to turkey in the end of june.our travel agent booked us in sultanhan hotel.at that point we were not so happy with her booking us into this hotel as we thought that it was not a part of a big chain like intercontinental or crowne plaza. but,we were wrong. sultanhan is a beautiful boutique hotel,with the BEST LOCATION.it is so near to all the tourist hot spots (eg:- blue mosque,covered bazaar,etc.) rooms are okay.it would have been better if they could provide a complimentary tea/coffee maker. the terrace restaurant has a beautiful view.even if you do not have a meal there,do go there just for the view. the nearby tramway stations is cimberlitas. overall,a wonderful stay.would love to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled All My Wishes”
Reviews.Author: olympicoscar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location and great room. Staff very friendly at check-in. Very helpful with the luggage. Room very clean, very spacious, good view from balcony. Wi-fi worked wonderfully with our laptop, it was free. Beds very comfortable. TV and air-conditioning worked perfectly. The location near all of the attractions (Blue Mosque, Topkapi) etc. and a pedestrian shopping street make this hotel a gem. We were able to walk to everything. BTW we are in our mid sixties and even my wife never complained about the walking. Breakfast was included in the price. Very nice lobby that even had an English language newspaper to read. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while exploring Istanbul. Hotel itself is clean, well-renovated and well-maintained. Location was ideal - easy walking to the historical sites (and over the hill directly to the ferry terminal), but set back far enough west to give you a little breathing room from the crush of the tourist crowds. One note, the hotel is close to a main street, but is actually on a side street that cars can only access from the opposite direction. If you're taking a cab back from somewhere, be sure to grab one of the cards from the front desk with directions for taxis, or just get off on Divan Yolu and walk 50 feet to the hotel. Also, no business center, but there is a laptop you can ask for at the front desk to check email etc from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice”
Reviews.Author: lestay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sultanhan hotel for five and then two days in May. We could not have been more pleased with the hotel. Location: perfect location in the old center, yet quiet and very safe,.walking distance to all sights and tram. All conveniences around the hotel. Staff: excellent and extremely helpful and friendly. Everyone spoke English. Food: breakfast is first rate, fresh and plentiful. Hotel: super clean, very nicely furnished and classy decoration. excellent common area. small hiccup is that the air seemed off but the heat was bearable in may. we would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTwig
Reviews.Content: I echo the majority of reviewers. It's a nice hotel, very well located for the key sites, shopping and restaurants. Difficult to fault it. Friendly service and nice rooms. I'm only marking it slightly down because it was expensive - But maybe that's me getting grumpier with age! If you go you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Help at a Difficult Time”
Reviews.Author: wilcoxSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We were delayed by the Iceland Volcano. The hotel made every effort to help us. Excellent service and very friendly staff who made us welcome at all times. Close to tramline and many major Istanbul sites. Rooms quiet and well furnished. Roof top restaurant with 360degree view of skyline

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: apk62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sultanhan Hotel at the beginning and the end of our trip to Turkey. The hotel is clean and pretty. The rooms and bathrooms have plenty of space. There is a large selection of foods for breakfast, including cold meats and cheeses, breads, pastries, cereals, and an assortment of interesting jams, yoghurt, honey, etc. They also had a few hot items, which looked less appealing. The hotel is located just off of a main road, Divan Yolu Cadessi, where the tram runs. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and it is an easy walk to the Palace, Aya Sofya, and the Blue Mosque in one direction and the Grand Bazaar in the other direction. There is also a little market close by where you can buy water, fruit, etc. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. When our flight home was cancelled they let us use the computer at the front desk to look for alternative arrangements. When we had to extend our stay for 2 days they were able to accommodate us and we were very grateful. On our last morning we had to leave before breakfast. We asked for coffee to be brought to our room and they brought a huge tray of assorted breakfast foods! I would definitely go back to the Sultanhan!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Hans S
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights (altogether) in this hotel and it was very good. The location is great right in the heart of old town very close to all the major attractions. Can get a bit noisy but the location and friendly helpful staff make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “As Friendly & Attentive As Family”
Reviews.Author: gadgetjamz
Reviews.Content: We occupied two rooms during our stay, one with twin beds for my teenage daughter & our friend, and a king room for my husband and me, conveniently located immediately next door to each other. The staff couldn't have been any nicer, attending not only to our every need, but remembering what we had planned for the day and chatting with us about our experiences when we returned to the hotel at night. The breakfast was very nice, and the fabulous view from the glass-walled rooftop restaurant was a great way to start every morning. The location was great, and the demolition across the street was nothing but the most minor inconvenience. It was almost finished by the time we left, so I don't expect anyone else to have a problem. I will also recommend CTC Turkey Travel for private tours & guides. They were the ones who chose this hotel for us, and I have to say the combination of wonderful hotel and excellent guides made our trip a perfect one. Even my sullen 13 year old daughter had a wonderful time! We will stay at the Sultanhan next time we visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “My first Trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KlammerLancashire
Reviews.Content: Booked flight & hotel through expedia-good value compared with some travel companies. Hotel in excellent position, clean, staff freindly & helpfull but nobody told us about the demolition going on accross the road starting very early and finnishing at 12pm every night. Would recomened trip Advisers travel guide Soner Tufan "daily istanbul tours" great value included entrance fee's, lunch and transport. Their Transfer from airport to hotel we found reliable and the cheapest. Tip Try not to use the yellow Taxi's, they will take you for a ride. Ask the hotel to book a taxi then you will have some come back. Also booking a restraunt through the hotel, some restarants provide a free taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: MaguireNottingham
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed staying 4 nights here. Location perfect for main attractions. Hotel staff could not have been kinder or more efficient. Room very clean and well laid out and bathroom excellent. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel and excellent restaurant too”
Reviews.Author: Worlwide
Reviews.Content: Visiting out of season, we could not have been made more welcome by the hotel. Every member of staff was efficient, courteous and friendly, and anxious to please. Nothing was too much trouble. The Hotel Sultanhan is not a 5 star hotel, but it offers superb value. It is close to many of the main sights, including the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, and the tram stops nearby. Our bedroom was large, although a lot of space was taken by an extra small double bed we did not need. The fittings were perhaps a little dark and 'tired', but the bed was large and very comfortable, and a flat screen TV was installed while we were there. There was adequate drawer and hanging space, and a safe is provided. The slightly damp, musty smell on arrival was quickly dispersed by opening a window, and did not return. The bathroom was clean and well equipped, although used toiletries were not replaced. There was a very slight sewer smell occasionally from a drain in the floor. The hotel has a terrace restaurant on the fifth floor. The buffet breakfast was excellent, offering an enormous selection of cold food, and something hot each day too, all beautifully presented. We ate dinner there on our final evening, and decided that we should perhaps have eaten there every evening rather than going to some of the famous Istanbul restaurants. The meal was the best we had in the city. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Perfect Staff”
Reviews.Author: richardportnoy
Reviews.Content: We visited this Hotel with Friends. It is situated in the old part of Istanbul and perfect for visiting the Blue Mosque, etc. The tram line is very close which can take you to most anywhere you want to go. The breakfast buffet is more than adequate. The staff are very friendly and helpful. As it wasout of season there were not many guests in the Hotel. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the last night and though a little more expensive than the other restaurants we visited the food more than made up for it. The rooms are a little dark but very comfortable. As requested we stayed on the 3rd floor facing the front. The room was very quiet. I can think of nothing to complain about this Hotel and for the Internet price we had it was "perfect". A there was 6 of us we had our own guide and transportation when required. It was much less expensive than taking tours. Traffic in Istanbul is horrendous so where you can walk or take a tram or metro it saves time. We recommend Kathisma Restaurant. Hamdi near the Spice Market is well known but a little rushed and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for the first visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: timandcarol135
Reviews.Content: This is one excellent hotel. Great, quiet location, close to all of the popular antiquities and 50 yds to the tramway that gets you to almost anywhere you need to go in Istanbul. The rooms are absolutely first-class and the staff are ready to solve any problem or make excellent recommendations. The breakfast buffet is very well stocked and the view from the roof terrace is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiteSeeingus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 3 night stay at this wonderful hotel. Terrific location on a quiet street (never was disturbed by any outside noise) but just off a main street with lots of restaurants. We had a lovely room on the 3rd floor, front (front facing rooms have a more pleasant view). The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is walking distance to most old city sights and we felt safe and comfortable even walking to the Orient House dinner show at night (touristy but enjoyable). There was a wonderful roof-top restaurant but the weather was a little cool and foggy the days we were there, so we ate breakfast inside, with wall to wall windows to capture the view. We thoroughly enjoyed visiting Istanbul and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average for the rpice”
Reviews.Author: sswh1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. Found the hotel poor value for the 4 star price. On the upside, it is located in a quiet street and rooms at the back of the hotel are quiet. Short walk to metro stops and a lot of very touristy restaurants, close to all attractions. Breakfast (included) was generous and the rooftop setting is pleasant. Service was good, the staff were very helpful. The lobby is pleasant, with character furniture and windows onto the square. Downsides - the airconditioning in our room did not work well enough to cool the room. The rooms at the front have balconies and doors overlooking trees and a cobbled street. Those at the back overlook the back of what appears to be another hotel, with very loud air conditioning units. These are not audible once the window is closed, but mean the windows must be kept closed the entire time. Lighting was very dim, the room overall was dark. Two towels for two people, called for more, they were not replaced. Shower flooded the bathroom every time it was used. Mould in shower. Suspect staying at a room in the front, with fresh air and pleasant outlook, would have been a much better experience. "Cable" TV was two news station and BBC TV - no movies or sports. The restaurant was overpriced and the food deeply average - it had the atmosphere of a hotel used for package tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel near everything.”
Reviews.Author: dad58potomac
Reviews.Content: Well located right in the middle of the Old City, the Sultanhan Hotel was close to all the historic places on my "to tour" list. It is a midsize boutique hotel with European charm on a quiet dead end street. The price was extremely moderate. The staff was very accommodating and professional. My room was well-appointed and clean. Breakfast offerings were delicious, but I really liked the hotel restaurant's view overlooking the Sea of Marmara. Drinks in the evening, again at the restaurant, offered another breath-taking view of the lighted Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. I would certainly recommend the Sultananhan Hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted in an Istanbul hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrr108
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted a nice, mid-sized hotel right in the heart of the Old City in Istanbul and the Sultanhan fit the bill perfectly. Aside from the location, less than a block from the tram line (which is wonderful and which we used all the time to get around the city), the hotel offered peace and quiet on a dead end street while still being in the middle of all the frenetic action of Sultanhamet. The staff of the hotel was wonderful and tried to answer all our questions and help in any way they could. They even offer laptops at the front desk so you can check your e-mail while there. (I know someone else said they were charged a nominal fee for this, but we were never asked for any money to use the computers.) And, the roof top restaurant and deck were just lovely. Breakfast included a wealth of offerings that were tasty and appealing. And, since it was still warm, we sat outside every morning and ate while looking over the Sea of Marmara. Just beautiful. Then, in the evening, after we got back to the hotel from dinner and wandering the city, my friend and I would sit on the very top roof deck in comfy chairs drinking wine and looking at the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia all lit up right in front of us. Breathtaking! The hotel rooms were fine, clean, well appointed, and, as mentioned before, quiet. The only issue I had was with the air conditioning which I found lacking. If this happens to you, I suggest you ask the front desk to change your room. My friend's room was nice and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location with accomodating service”
Reviews.Author: flar6x6
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller hotel located between the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar on a very quiet dead-end street less than a block from the tram line. The rooms are very clean,comfortable and well furnished but plain. The lobby area is very nice with a full service bar. Breakfast service is on the rooftop garden area with a nice view of the old city area. Wi-Fi service is available and laptops are available from the desk at a nominal fee. We were leaving Istanbul on 6am flight meaning we were up ready to go before 4am. The night staff had coffee and breakfast bread waiting on us when we came down. A really nice touch to end a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHarriet
Reviews.Content: Welcoming, helpful and efficient reception staff created a favourable impression from the outset. Sultanhan Hotel is within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern & Hippodrome. Excellent rooftop terrace restaurant with panoramic sea views where we ate dinner by candlelight and also enjoyed a very good breakfast. Comfortably furnished, spotlessly clean Ottoman style room with small ensuite. Located on a quiet "no through" street yet right in the heart of the historic part of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MEK71
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this beautiful hotel with friends and had a wonderful time. This has to be one of the best hotels that I have stayed in. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very nice. We enjoyed the dinner on the roof terrace and ate there both nights. The breakfast buffet is also very good and the view alone from the terrace is worth the stay. The food is superb. The rooms are very clean and well appointed. Many of the best sites of Istanbul are within a 20 minute walk. The Spice Market and the Grand Bazaar are close by. The Blue Mosque is almost across the street. It is on a short street that is very quiet. I can only repeat what the other rave reviews have said, it is a great place to stay to see a great city.

Reviews.Title: “super location”
Reviews.Author: huntejk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Super location - few minutes walk from Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi. Right on tram line. Room was large, comfortable and spotless. Bath was good sized and modern. Service was remarkably good. Wifi and able to print out boarding passes. Excellent breakfast and rooftop dining with fabulous view. Great value. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “better than I thought!!!”
Reviews.Author: adaytripper2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after traveling through Turkey. We stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial during the first few days in Istanbul, which we loved for its charm and service (see my other review). We actually tried to stay at the Ottoman on our return, but sadly, it was booked. The staff recommended this hotel, as we wanted to continue exploring Sultanahmet. At first, I was put off by the staff at the hotel...not friendly or helpful. However, there were 2 things that really stood out for me. 1. the rooftop restaurant has incredible views of the city, and very nice food. 2. the rooms are gorgeous (and probably nicer than the Ottoman). I can get over the cool reception by the staff. 3. High speed internet in the lobby and the front desk will lend you a laptop for free, which is helpful when you have been trekking through turkey with no real world connection for over a week. Overall, less charming than Ottoman, but beautiful rooms, great location and good restaurant. Would stay here again too!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: langsource
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for about a week. I cannot say enough about how wonderful it was. The location is perfect - you can walk to the tram and to all the interesting sights in the old town. Dinner at a nice restaurant is at most a 5 minute walk. The hotel is absolutely beautiful! We had a lovely room with a little balcony-it was modern and yet also authentic. Breakfast on the terrace is magnificent. But I must say the best part of this hotel is the gracious staff - everyone was so helpful and went out of their way to make us comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel - I travel overseas a lot and this was definitely one of the best hotel experiences I have had.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbuck4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sultanhan for 4 nights, and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They instantly made me feel at home. The hotel is in a great location, central to everything, such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and the Cistern. Also, as noted in the previous review, the Cemberlitas tram stop is feet away and the Grand Bazaar is right off Cemberlitas. My room was large, clean, with a big bathroom and all the amenities you could want. Wireless is free, as they have a couple of laptops there for guests to use. The restaurant is really nice, food tastes great, and again, the waitstaff was great. Can't say enough about these guys. You should stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, except for nonfunctioning AC”
Reviews.Author: RetiredConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, spacious rooms, helpful staff, great terrace. Sadly, airconditioning was not working in the heat

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: JoanneBrussels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this charming hotel which is conveniently located in a very central, quiet spot in the heart of "old" Istanbul. All major sights are within walking distance of the hotel. Staff is very efficient and helpful, always smiling. Weather permitting, you can enjoy a copious breakfast outside on the terrace of the restaurant, with a great view of Istanbul's sights. We had one lovely lunch and one great dinner at the Sultanhan's restaurant. We preferred their daily menu, served by very professional and friendly waiters, over what we had the other days when we ate out. Also: their restaurant prices are very reasonable. Tip: avoid a room on the 4th floor, the restaurant being on the 5th floor. We woke up at 6:00 every morning by the noise of scraping chairs and feet stomping above our heads in the restaurant. No way of getting back to sleep. We had room nr. 408: not too big. There was a hole above the edge of the bath tub, where something apparently fell off and was not repaired. This was the only minor point though of this overall very good hotel. We should probably have asked to be given another room in order to sleep a bit later in the morning, but decided we couldn't be bothered for such a short stay. Hotel to be warmly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sussex9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Istanbul where we stayed at the Sultanhan Hotel for 4 nights and it was absolutely wonderful! This stylish hotel is situated in a quite spot in the Sultanahmet district within walking distance of all the major attractions. We had a spacious, beautifully decorated (as is the rest of the hotel) room and the food was superb, but what really sets this hotel apart is its staff. From the waiters in the restaurant to the staff at the reception desk, they were all very friendly and helpful and really tried to make our stay an unforgettable and pleasant experience. Well, they succeeded - our stay at the Sultanhan was magical and surpassed our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: davgiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over New Year and dont have a bad word to say about my stay. Arrived about 2am and quick check in and up to the room. Room was ideal for a 4 night stay, clean and spacious without being fancy. The hotel is next to the tram line and only a very short walk to the main sites and some excellent restaurants. Did not eat in the hotel but heard good reports about the restaurant and the views from the restaurant would be stunning in the summer Overall a good value hotel and an excellent base for exploring an interesting city

Reviews.Title: “They got too greedy - The owner now thinks only of money”
Reviews.Author: AgentBBB
Reviews.Content: Had I known this review site existed earlier, I would have left this review long ago. I had stayed at this hotel many times since it first opened, and had always had a fine experience. HOWEVER, my LAST experience was a disaster! They informed me that they had INCREASED my room rate only AFTER I had checked into my room and had already unpacked. I had reserved and confirmed my room 2 months BEFORE my arrival, yet they had the amateurish, cheap, unapologetic audacity to inform me that they were increasing my room rate AFTER I had already gone to my room, unpacked, and was leaving my key at the reception, as I was on my way out, fifteen minutes after checking in. It was the greedy, unprofessional owner, (some unshaven, cheap-looking man named Kumal, or Kimal), who did this, and not the manager, who was so profoundly embarrassed by the owner's behavior, he could not look me in the eye. Is THIS the behavior of a high-end, professional hotel? Previous guests are usually informed of price increases at the time they make their reservations to return. Don't be fooled by the glitzy appearance of this hotel folks. They care ONLY about your money. The building may be lovely, and in a great location, but it cannot overcome the greedy, short-sighted, crude behavior of this man who owns it. He will, undoubtedly be your dearest friend if you pay him enough, but how can one be sure how much that really is when he changes his prices AFTER you arrive? He is a disgrace to traditional Turkish hospitality! By the way, wishing to illustrate to him the behavior of a proper gentleman, I simply packed my bags and went elsewhere. There would have been no need to make a huge fuss.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Joy1P
Reviews.Content: This was a wondeful hotel from the brilliant position to the excellent service. My husband travels worldwide and thought this was one of the best hotels he has stayed in, due to its individuality, service and pleasant decor. For a city hotel we couldn't have asked for anything more. If we go back to Istanbul we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - good sevice”
Reviews.Author: aqsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mum and sister at the beginning of the year and had no complaints about it whatsoever. Travelling around a lot, you get used to a feel for the people generally in other countries, and Turkish people were lovely - including all the staff at the hotel. The room were very clean. Breakfast was nice and the staff were ever helpful. They would jump up to try and give any advice about getting around and what to do and what not to. Reception staff were very friendly and we had a lovely young and extremely efficient concierge called husnu who was happy to resolve any problem we had! Regarding location, it was perfectly located near the major sites (i.e - aya sophia, the blue mosque, the turkish arts museum, topkapi palace, grand bazaar) and also the tram should you wish to travel by public transport. It was located just off the main road and finding taxis was no problem. The views from the terrace were lovely. The only difficulty we really expeienced was finding the hotel by taxi upon our arrival - so make sure you have the hotel number ready to call in case the taxi driver doesnt know where it is located.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel .loved it.”
Reviews.Author: petmar7
Reviews.Content: Well placed for all the sites large comfortable rooms good food {check out the choc pudding] good service Ali will fix anything for you. Air conditioning could be a little better.

Reviews.Title: “The extra mile”
Reviews.Author: travelread
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sultanhan for a total of 4 nights last month. The rooms are on the large side, furnished nicely, and the windows open for fresh air. The breakfast was lovely, with fresh fruit, fresh juice, and wonderful pastries ( as well as meats, eggs, olives, cheeses) every day. The view from the dining room is beautiful and even more expansive from the roof. We didn't eat outside because of the weather; in warm weather it would be a perfect place to relax and take in the view of Istanbul. The location is perfect; close to all major attractions in Sultanahmet but on a side street with trees so just a bit quieter and more peaceful. The tram is 1/2 block away. So far, so good. My husband's wallet was stolen (on the crowded tram; be careful) and we returned to the hotel to call our credit card companies. Here is where the people of the Sultanhan really shine! Burcu, at the front desk, and the hotel manager (sorry, we didn't get his name) spent over 1 hour helping us contact our credit card companies to report our cards stolen. The international numbers on the cards did not work and Burcu and the hotel manager repeatedly called local Turkish numbers and helped us place collect calls. They were so kind and helpful. This kind of assistance is what makes a hotel special. Many thanks to Burcu, the hotel manager, and the Sultanhan for helping make our trip to Istanbul wonderful! (And don't worry too much about the stolen wallet. We walked everywhere and never felt in danger. Happens in every big city with tourists. Just keep your purse close and use a money belt.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: diamond63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel at the end of September to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. The hotel has a great location on a quiet side road in the centre of the old town, 5mins walking distance to lots of restaurants and around 10-15mins to the Blue Mosque,Topaki Palace and Hagia Sophia. The hotel itself has a very impressive lobby with bar and comfortable seating. The reception desk spoke good english and were friendly and helpful at all times. The room was a good size, tastefully decorated, and clean. The dining room was lovely, we never ate an evening meal in it but breakfast was served there, good choice, most things you would normally expect. In my opinion, a great hotel in a perfect location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: bokki
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Sultanhan Hotel before touring other areas of the country and then returned for a final night before heading back to Canada. The hotel is a little gem in the heart of the old city of Istanbul. The rooms were beautifully furnished with well stocked bathrooms including toiletries and towelling slippers embroidered with the hotels logo on them. We had been warned that we may be woken up before dawn with the call to prayers at the surrounding Mosques, but with the double glazed windows and the aircon switched on, we heard nothing. The buffet breakfasts served on the rooftop patio were wonderful - everything you could imagine - breads, buns, waffles, all kinds of homemade jams and preserves, REAL yogurt (not the kind we are used to getting in North America), fresh fruit, dried fruit, nuts, cereals, cheeses, olives, meats, juices, tea/coffee/juice. The staff were friendly and always ready to fill your coffee cup. There is a sauna and Hamam downstairs, but you do have to make a reservation and there is an extra charge - we went a couple of blocks away to the historic Cemberlitas Hamam and had the works which included a 30 minute oil massage after being slathered and pummelled on the hot marble slab in the hamam! An experience you'll never forget and not to be missed! When we returned to stay at the Sultanhan a week later, we were recognized and asked how our trip had been. On our last night we decided to eat dinner on the rooftop patio. There was a set menu for 55 Turkish Lira which included assorted mezes plate for each person, a huge salad, choice of steak, chicken or sea bream and a chocolate lava cake with ice cream for dessert. This also included a glass of wine, which was quite the bargain considering the price of wine everywhere in Turkey! The food was delicious and our waiter, Ali was fantastic. Except for one other couple, we had the entire rooftop to ourselves. We heard the call to prayer from the surrounding mosques as we ate our dinner and watched the sunset - a perfect ending to an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Abhishek29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Istanbul in June and stayed at the Sultanhan Hotel for five nights and it was absolutely GREAT. Right upon entering the hotel we were impressed by their beautiful and spacious lobby. The room we stayed in was very nice, spacious and comfortable complete with all the necessary requirements. All the staff members of the hotel, be it the front desk, terrace restaurant or room service, were very very helpful and easy to talk to. The terrace restaurant offered us a very nice view of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and the food was great, including breakfasts. The best aspect of the hotel though is its location. The Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, and Aya Sofia are within a 5-7 minutes walking distance of the hotel. In addition, there are tons of good places to eat near the hotel. All in all, my wife and I loved Istanbul and thoroughly enjoyed staying at Sultanhan. We would definitely stay here again if we ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “The real Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: Veletadelmudno
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is probably the most fascinating place I have ever been to. I would highly recommend to stay on a hotel in the old city, Sultanahmet, to experience the real thing. I stayed for nearly a week at the Sultanhan Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, the location was perfect, right in the heart of Sultanahmet. The overall hotel fine, clean. The accomodations impecable. It does have a dining room and a terrace on the last floor where you have a total view of the entire city, the perfect spot to take incredible pictures. The blue mosque and Aya SofÃ­a, you could almost touch them. We used to take daily breakfast with this fascinating view. We never had lunch or dinner down there. I would recommend to do that some place else and try the turkish sweets, donners and koftes. But the breakfast, had everything you need, fresh fruit, juices, cereals, yogurt, bread, coffee, and tea. The personnel was always friendly. If I ever go back I would definitely stay at the Sultanhan, no second thoughts about it.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: emgtraveller
Reviews.Content: absolutely wonderful. not the four seasons, but not the price either. very convenient and clean and everyone was friendly and very helpful. breakfast buffets were great. very close to sights and places to eat. would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shliben
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for 5 nights with my wife. The staff are great - really helpful; the hotel is in a quiet street just metres from the main tram street and only minutes from the key sites and 10/15 mins from the ferry port. The roof restaurant has great views, a great breakfast and a lovely drinks terrace. Room was a good size with a great shower and large bath, Bed very comfortable. We were collected from the airport by the house MPV and the driver gave us a quick sightseeing tour before dropping us at the hotel. If you book direct with the hotel the collection is free, if you book through an agency its â‚¬30. We would really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Superb Food Service”
Reviews.Author: Mike10008
Reviews.Content: Located in the midst of Sultanahmet, the core of tourist sites in Istanbul. Terrace restaurant food selection and preparation was very good. Both breakfast and dinner waiters were very kind and efficient. Menu contained a wide variety of meals. Great presentation! Rooms were nice and clean, though not large. But then, we didn't travel there to spend a lot of time in the room. Overall, very nice run hotel in a great location. One block to the Light Rail Station and two blocks to the Grand Bazaar or Mosques.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UK-James72
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel largely because of the positive feedback from this site it is disappointing to post a negative review. After booking a double room (clearly stated on the booking form) the hotel put us in a twin room. When we asked to be moved we were put in the smallest room where the bathroom door would hit the toilet every time it opened. The room was also super hot. In sum â€“ not appropriate against the rate we were paying. Finally put us in an appropriate room. Even then â€“ the air-con didnâ€™t work. The breakfast was nothing special â€“ and service for the breakfast was terrible. The restaurant was a miserable room to say the least â€“ canâ€™t imagine why anyone would choose to eat here. Out of 4 nights we only had the breakfast once as it wasnâ€™t a good start to the day to be in that room. The reception/foyer area of the hotel usually smelled of smoke (accept that this can be difficult to avoid in Turkey). When we thought things had settled down we had one night of terrible sleep caused by a constant humming noise coming from the walls â€“ we could even feel the vibration in the wall. This woke us up on several occasions. Complaints to the night staff were to no use. They did offer to move us (at 3 in the morning) but the new room was just as bad. Complaints to management were met with a response of â€˜there is nothing we can doâ€™. We asked the manager to get back to us with a more appropriate response and never heard back from him. One more grievance - having flown into Istanbul airport and withdrawn cash from a machine at the airport we didnâ€™t have any change. Our taxi driver struggled to find the hotel, took wrong turns and asked several times for directions â€“ all adding to the fare. On arrival, the check-in desk tried to assist with arranging change and gave the taxi driver a totally undeserved tip without asking us. To keep this balanced â€“ this hotel is close to the central tourist attractions. That is about the only positive I can think of â€“ and even with this in mind I would advise anyone to stay across the other side of the river (better restaurants etc) and visit the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; great location”
Reviews.Author: longbrow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, close to the traditional sites - Sultan Ahmet mosque, Haghia Sopphia, etc. It's also right on the tram line, which will quickly take you to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar and other areas of interest. The staff is attentive, the rooms are well-appointed and the view from the rooftop terrace is spectacular. Highly recommend this hotel - especially is this is your first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beechmk
Reviews.Content: Sultanhan had good, patient and helpful front desk staff who went beyond merely giving directions and making reservations. I had several long and informative discussions with front desk people about Turkey. It's in Sultanahmet, and close to most historic attractions. The tram is almost at the door which gives cheap, fast, clean service to the European side of the city, which allows a traveler to get away from high restaurant prices in Sultanahmet. The breakfast buffet featured olives and cheese, and was generally superior. We ate at the hotel restaurant (which I usually avoid) which was a fine meal for a fixed price. Downside: lobby bar and laundry prices are wildly expensive, $4.80 for a very small cup of tea. Stay here if you can't afford the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Simple luxury”
Reviews.Author: Digbyzinho
Reviews.Content: The best location on Sultanhamet!!!! This is a very discrete hotel, with wonderful rooms, wonderful views, very nice breakfest, clean, extremely confortable. I felt at home over there! They even have an own turkish bath on the basement (although I prefer the Cimberlitas some blocks away).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: karachi_tourist
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Istanbul on our first visit there and wish to go back in the summers. I booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. I must say it was a great hotel, brilliant location and very friendly staff. As soon as our taxi entered sultanahmet area our smiles went away b/c it seemed a bit run down with quiet cheesy hotels around but when the car stopped infront of Hotel Sultanhan we got our smiles back. It has a great big enterance hallway which is very clean and spotless. The staff was friendly and the manager spoke English. The room was the best part, good size, newly refurbished and spotless bathroom. When we arrived there was no cot in the room as ordered on the internet and niether was their an iron. We brought this to the attention of the manager before leaving for dinner and by the time we got back it was all done. It's located 200 yards from Divan Yolu (Tramway) the main tourist road. Nearest tram station is 500 yards away. The tram can be used to go as far as Dolmebache Palace (get off at Kabitas stop)The Turkish Hamam Cimberlast is only 5 minute walk. The blue Mosque is a 5-6 minutes walk and Haghia Sophia is right opposite the mosque. Topkapi palace would be a 10 minute walk (max) and the Grand Bazaar would be the same distance. We also use the sight seeing bus parked infront of Haghia Sophia (but i thought it was a waste of 35 YTL -PP). Since we had an 8 month old baby with us the prime location helped greatly as we could go back after seeing one site and freshen him up for another trip. The breakfast was great and had good variety from cold to hot and the staff in the restaurant was even more friendlier to our baby helping to look after him while we ate. We made good friends with Engen over there who alsi guided us about local sight seeing and price range of different product. We also tried their roof top restaurant for dinner one day and it was really good (overpriced though 25 Euro per person) and had 3 course meal. The only flaw I can think of is that there was no electric kettle in the room and since we neede hot water to make the baby's milk therefore it was a bit of a hassle. But the hotel overcame this by giving his hot water in a glass kettle in the evening when we called them up. The room rate can be said to be overpriced and if they were slightly cheaper then this would have been a 5 star holiday. So in short it was a great stay and we hopefully shall go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: swinesheadvillage
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with very welcoming staff. Rooms a little small, but very quiet. Didnt try the restaurant apart from breakfast which was excellent and magnificent views from the terrace. Hotel in great shape, and perfect for a weekend visit, apart from being asked if we wanted to buy a carpet by the duty staff when we checked out!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: martindp
Reviews.Content: I suspect it's been said before, but just returned from an excellent stay at this hotel - friendly helpful staff, very clean (for example bedlinen changed every night), and a perfect location - within minutes of all key sights and the tram stop (yet a quiet side street). Would highly recommend it. It's also easy to walk to a good choice of restaurants (particularly liked Balikci Sabahattin and cheaper Buhara - refer Lonely Planet), and over in Beyoglu we were not disappointed by the much-vaunted Mikla. A fabulous city - our first visit - and a great hotel to be based at.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ruth72045
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted at this hotel. Beautiful lobby, friendly helpful staff. We got a 3 night package including breakfasts and transfers. The breakfasts on the roof Terrace cafe were fabulous. The Turkish cheeses and fruit and tomatoes and olives were so good. It is walking distance to many attractions, and close to the Metro. Would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with a superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: mrskat99
Reviews.Content: It was a bit daunting choosing a hotel without breaking the bank, we chose the Sultanahmet, as we wanted something with personality, but above all, affordable. So, we crossed our fingers and hoped for the best. We were pleasantly suprised. I had e-mailed the hotel inquiring as to airport pick up, their reponse was immediate and very informative giving us several options. We chose the have them meet us at the airport. The driver was lovely, giving us a quick description of all of the sights we saw along the way. The sampling of Turkish delight was a nice touch. Our room was small, but extremely comfortable and immaculate. The front desk staff very helpful with restaurant recommendations, bookings and sight-seeing information. I don't think there is a language that they don't speak. There is a bar in the reception area and the bartender was superb! Every afternoon when we came back in from our outings he would greet my husband with a beer and snacks and me with a fresh squeezed lemonade, the best I have ever tasted. The guests at the hotel come from all points across the globe and we were fortunate to make quite a few new friends. The location couldn't be more perfect. The view from the balcony above the restaurant is a 360 degree panorama of the old city, the Sea of Marmara, the Bosphorous, not to metion Haga Sophia and the Blue Mosque. All of the major sights are within walking distance. The tram stop is at the end of the street and the ferries are about a 15 minute walk away. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast (included). I must recommend The Cistern, which is across from Haga Sophia for dinner, an actual cistern that had been converted and 5 Kat in Beyoglu. Make sure you book for a table near the window for an amazing view of the Bosphorous at night. The hotel value was great, however, Istanbul is no longer the bargain it once was and we found it quite expensive. Also, in the bazaar district the touts are quite annoying, but if you take it with humor you should love Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “IN the center of the Tourist Destinations very good, and very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Seberus
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally located. Just a block and a half from the tram, a few short blocks to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar, a block and a half to the famous Hamam ( steam bath) Charmelitash and generally in the tourist hub. Very nicely, but moderately decorated lobby and rooms. Twenty four hour, very helpful and friendly consierge. Air conditioning worked well, rooms were large, bathrooms were adequate with very nice amenities. The views are really from the roof ( if you crane your neck on some of the rooms with a terrace, you can see the Marmaris) but the view from the terrace is spectacular. The breakfasts were sumptuous, wonderful Turkish pastries, croisants, a variety of cheeses, sessame spreads, fresh juices. The wait staff was effusively attentive and the view from the terrace absolutely memorable. The trick is not to spend the whole morning at breakfast! There is internet in the lobby, and , off and on in your room ( at least when we were there ). It was a bit of an annoyance to have to go to the lobby, but it was complimentary, and they were not in control of the situation. There is a Hamam in the basement which is very nice, if you know how to use it , because it is not attended.....you are sort of on your own. They offer massages , but the lady who officiated did a mediocre job and didn't understand English....if you have a tender spot ....good luck!!..... All in all a wonderful hotel! If the Four Seasons or the Cirogan palace are out of your league, this hotel will not disppoint.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sultanhan is a good choice for a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: papyrus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sultanhan Hotel for 4 nights with a friend after traveling in Greece. We opted to book directly rather than Expedia, to get a discounted rate and an airport pick up. We were picked up at the airport by a delightful man hired by the hotel who brought along his young daughter, as it was a Saturday morning. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous in getting us situated and making suggestions how to get around. They let us look at four rooms before we made our choice (we had asked in advance to stay away from the staff elevator, due to a review on this site). The room was spacious and clean, with decent A/C. We faced an inner courtyard on the recommendation that it was quiet, and it was. It began to get hot the week we were there; we found the lobby without A/C tough for the guests and worse for the staff who had to stay there all day in the heat. I hope they've turned it on air conditioning in the public rooms now that it is so hot there, as the reception and lobby area is very pleasant as a place to relax, look at the internet etc. By the way, I never had a problem getting access on the hotel computer, but it's confusing until you figure out the keyboard "translations", then it's fine. The desk staff is patient and will help you sort it out. The breakfasts are wonderful, as is the roof terrace. Don't forget to go to the very top, I only discovered the higher terrace on the last night there. The hotel gives the standard, but delicous assortment of typical Turkish fare, plus scrambled eggs. I was impressed by the service and the food. The hotel restaurant is really good. A couple of nights after we enjoyed the Cemberlitas bath, my friend and I opted for soup and fresh rolls, with the vegetable lasagna or soup on its own. The soup is fantastic, and the rolls are tasty. The waiter treated us like royalty, even when having a modest meal. We got stuck in the elevator when the power went off briefly, which was a little disconcerting as there is no light to see the emergency ringer, or intercom to call the front desk. We asked them to improve this. Another thing you should clearly watch for near the hotel and along the main street is that pavements for walking are at all different levels. There is often a step down which at dusk is easily missed by a tired arrival, or if you're looking around at the sites.
