I almost tripped myself one evening, when distracted by a local vendor calling out the usual "Lady, lady" .... A couple who arrived at the hotel had a nasty accident one evening. They were going to the bank at dusk for cash after arriving, he missed the step, went flying and broke his arm and cut his eye. I happened to walk by just as it occurred, it was quite upsetting. There are no reflective strips anywhere to warn tourists that there is uneven pavement, even in a highly trafficked tourist area. However, all the bystanders were there to help - especially the lovely man outside El Torrito next door who called the paramedics. Seeing them later on, the couple stated the local hospitals both public and private were good and they got good treatment. The hotel is close by the Blue Mosque, AyaSofia, the Grand Bazaar, and the incredible Cemberlitas hammam. More about hammams on another posting. I recommend Sultanhan as a good option for someone who wants to walk around and enjoy the old City.

Reviews.Title: “great location & helpful satff”
Reviews.Author: jagoda13
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and I was 4 1/2 months pregnant so we were a little concerned about accomodations. Our taxi driver had a hard time finding the hotel at first as it's on a small dead end street so we were initially a bit concerned. However, we were very pleasantly surprised at the nice, clean & relatively spacious room that awaited us. We were on the back side of the building so it was quiet (but had no view, overlooking a residential building.) The hotel staff was very nice and friendly, helping us to decide on certain restaurants. The breakfasts were fairly extensive and good quality. Plus the view from the restaurant & roofdeck can't be beat! The location is excellent, right in the heart of the Sultanahmet area of the city so very close to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Cisterns, etc. We walked everywhere. Istanbul is a fascinating city with a rich history, nice people & surprisingly good food. We decided to book a turkish bath experience with the hotel and found it to be worthwhile. The masseuse was a slightly Donatella Versace-esque woman from Ukraine with very strong muscles & a minimal sense of modesty. But she was nice and very concerned to appropriately adjust the treatments to my pregnant state. My only complaint is that although our room was a non-smoking room, the central air system brought smoke from other rooms into ours. All in all, we were very satisfied with our choice in hotel and would stay at Sultanhan Hotel on a return trip to Istanbul. We enjoyed our 5 nights here very much.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel to Stay In”
Reviews.Author: flyingjay99
Reviews.Content: Sultanhan Hotel was a lovely place to stay while in Instanbul. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were pleasant and clean. The hotel was conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “no internet access and noise at night, good location”
Reviews.Author: manegad
Reviews.Content: I spend one week in the hotel in June. I chose the hotel because besides the good location, in the web is stated that there is Wireless Internet Access in the rooms. For that reason I paid 230euros per night . I was dissapointed and was the deception that upset me most. The only solution that the hotel gave me was to conect my computer in the lobby and there was just one power point on the wall. Every night there were people with the computer in the lobby (not very big for the category of the hotel) and other people waiting to use that power point. The room was ok but very noisy at night because of the air conditioning system (besides mine was turned off). Light in the morning due to the curtains and small sheets on the bed that just covered the upper side of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKB7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well situated, within walking distance from many attractions in Istanbul,ie The Blue Mosque, Sophia Palace etc. Staff particularly friendly. Needed a car and driver for a couple of hours and one of the reception staff volunteered, acted as guide for 5 hours and was delighted with USD50 as the fee....naturally we paid him much more but it was'nt expected. We covered about 200km on both sides of the Bosphorous, a truly great experience by a very proud Turk. The hotel is furnished in the Otterman style, very clean and fresh, breakfast included at very copetitive rates. website : [--]

HotelInfo.Name: Sultanhan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piere Loti Cad No.15, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
